page.title: 13Services
page.content:
ADDLESTONE POLICE STATION
There are 60 police officers at Addlestone Police Station which covers three divisions of Surrey. The station has eight cells, six for men, and two for women. Addlestone and the surrounding area is quite affluent, so there is not much serious crime. Over the past few years however, there has been a steady rise in crime. The most common crime is bicycle theft, approximately ten percent of all crime. Violent crime is comparatively rare but some of the more serious crimes are committed by gangs from London. The most likely age for a criminal is between 19 and 26 years. More men commit crime than women. For every 100 crimes reported 47 are solved.
